#Text=Interview with Curtis Grant , Regional Council candidate for Wards 2 & 6 in Brampton , Canada
#Text=Friday , October 6 , 2006
#Text=The upcoming 2006 Brampton municipal election , to be held November 13 , features an array of candidates looking to represent their wards in city council or the council of the Peel Region .
#Text=Wikinews contributor Nick Moreau contacted many of the candidates , including Curtis Grant , asking them to answer common questions sent in an email .
#Text=This ward 's incumbent is Paul Palleschi , also challenging Palleschi is Vicky Colbourne , David Esho , Chuck Jeffrey , and Tejinder Singh .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Q : List the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A : Traffic congestion , community safety , and lack of funding for health and social services .
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A : Traffic congestion .
#Text=Q : What qualities or experiences do you possess , that make you more desirable than the incumbent ?
#Text=A : I am passionate and dedicated about building Brampton into a healthier , safer and more prosperous City .
#Text=I like challenge and I have the ability to work cohesively with all management levels .
#Text=Q : Why do you want to represent your ward on council ?
#Text=A : I love the citizens of Wards 2 & 6 and I believe in putting them front and center of government policies and programs and in a strong and united regional government .
#Text=Q : Of the decisions made by council since the last election , which one would you have changed , and why ?
#Text=A : I would change the rate of development .
#Text=This would minimize the negative impacts on our residents and give the city enough time to expand existing infrastructure .
#Text=Q : How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=A : For the past fourteen years I have dedicated my time and skills to volunteering in different community organizations in the cities of Brampton and Toronto .
#Text=I served in the role of Youth Leader , Mentor and Teacher and most recently Ministry Coordinator .
#Text=Q : Much of Brampton 's existing council is quite seasoned in the civic political process .
#Text=What could you bring to the table as a " rookie " , above and beyond the current roster of councillors ?
#Text=A : As Regional Councillor for Wards 2 & 6 , I will put forth a proactive and sustainable plan to build A Stronger Brampton , Stronger Region .
#Text=I am committed to improving access to government , reducing traffic congestion and enhancing our infrastructure to meet our current and growing demands .
#Text=I will work to improve the delivery of public health services and I am dedicated to making our City safer .
#Text=I will strengthen our parks , culture and recreation master plan , build a stronger economy , protect the environment and enhance our social services .
#Text=Q : The Rose Theatre recently launched .
#Text=What are your thoughts on this facility ?
#Text=Have you had a chance to tour it yet ?
#Text=A : The Rose Theatre is wonderful place to showcase local , national and international talent .
#Text=It is an excellent way to boost Brampton 's economy .
#Text=I have n't had a chance to tour it yet .
#Text=Q : The province has strongly encouraged the development of high-density residences near the downtown .
#Text=Do these buildings fit in with your vision of the downtown ?
#Text=How much say should other levels of government have in urban planning ?
#Text=A : I believe in revitalizing the downtown core with high-density residences .
#Text=I believe urban planning should be a collaborative effort between all levels of government .
#Text=Q : How do you feel about Brampton 's rate of expansion ?
#Text=Council recently capped the annual amount of new development ; do you agree completely with this decision , would you have slowed development even further , or not have imposed a cap at all ?
#Text=A : I Support a cap to slow development in Brampton , but a cap alone is not enough .

#Text=Council must continue to engage the Provincial government and other municipalities in developing a better population and employment distribution plan for GTA to relieve the development pressure on Brampton .
#Text=Q : Why should businesses be attracted to locating in Brampton ?

#Text=A : There are several reasons why businesses would want to relocate to Brampton , some of them include : The caring , helpful and hard working people who live here ; our skilled workforce ; we have stable energy supply ; we have a good supply of development land and a beautiful city .
#Text=Q : How could Brampton further itself in attracting corporate investment ?
#Text=A :

#Text=Some ways in which Brampton could further itself in attracting corporate investment could include : establishing more competitive municipal tax rate , improving our tourism industry and assisting with relocation costs .
#Text=Q : Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A : I have a passion to represent the residents of Wards 2 & 6 and the vision to build a stronger Brampton , Stronger Region .
#Text=Q : What does Brampton mean to you ?

#Text=A : Brampton is a wonderful city to call home , a wonderful city to raise my family , a wonderful city the get an education , a wonderful city to operate a business and I 'm proud to invite family and friends to visit .
